page.title: 12THE MANOR HOUSE,SEND
page.content: The old house was built in 1680. The house has had lots of alterations since it was first built. The front door and porch in front of the house has been moved towards the left and the hall has been made larger. At the side of the house there is a window that has been blocked up with bricks. This is because a long time ago people who owned big houses had to pay taxes for their windows. The bricks at the back are Victorian. The front are mid 17th century. The roof rafters inside the house are made of oak. There have been many owners of the Manor house. In 1845 the owner was Lord Lovelace's brother. Peter John Locking. The next owner was Lucy Lloyd who lived there with her two sons. The Bowerman family now live in the Manor House. Mr. Bowerman is secretary of the local History Society.
